input_check¶

lsystem.core.input_check.check_blank_line(obj)¶

Determines if the inputs are blank

lsystem.core.input_check.check_branching(obj)¶

determines if there is branching and if it is in a valid syntax

lsystem.core.input_check.check_if_numeric(obj)¶

determines if the inputs are numeric

lsystem.core.input_check.check_in_alphabet(obj)¶

determines if the characters are in the alphabet

lsystem.core.input_check.check_nd(obj)¶

determine if the percentages are valid

lsystem.core.input_check.check_prod_rule_format(obj)¶

determines if the production rules are in the proper format

lsystem.core.input_check.check_valid_numeric(obj)¶

determines if the numbers are valid

lsystem.core.input_check.input_check(obj)¶

collects all the input checks and determines if they are valid

lsystem_utils¶

This file for now is acting as a catch-all utility file.

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.generate_lsystem_2d(grammar)¶

Generates the L-System based off of the grammar

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.generate_lsystem_3d(grammar)¶

Generates the L-System based off of the grammar

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.get_saved_lsystem(key, saved_lsystems)¶

Gets the saved L-Systems

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.get_saved_path()¶

Returns the operating system dependent saved_lsystems.json path

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.load_saved_lsystems()¶

Loads the saved L Systems into our app

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.normalize_coordinates(coords, bound=0)¶

Normalizes the coordinates such that the largest vertice bound is 1 or -1.

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.remove_saved_lsystem(key)¶

Deletes saved lsystem by key by loading the file into a json object, removing the key, then writing the file back to disk.

lsystem.core.lsystem_utils.save_lsystem(key, grammar)¶

Saves a given lsystem to disk to “lsystem/saved_lsystems.json” Overwrites any previous lsystem defined with the same key.

parsing¶

This file performs all of the parsing

lsystem.core.parsing.nd_choice(prods)¶

Randomly selects the rule in nondeterminism

lsystem.core.parsing.parsed_thread(strings, prods, iters)¶

Takes in an axiom set of prods and number of iterations and generates the new string

lsystem.core.parsing.string_parse(strings, prod_rules)¶

NOTE: Context sensitive reads left to right, with longest key getting priority

str_temp is the current string it will be used to keep track of what parts of the string still need proccessing Context free implimentation idea: 1. sort the keys from longest to shortest 2. say the key is length n, if the first n letters of the string match the key, add prod[key] to the new string 3a.if the first n letters ever match a key remove the first n letters of the string 3b.default rule: a letter goes to itself

stack_loop 2D¶

This module makes the stack loop

lsystem.core.stack_loop.read_stack(stack, starting_pt, angle, turn_angle, line_scale)¶

Input list of strings (F, +, -) Output List of new vertices

lsystem.core.stack_loop.read_substring(lsys, curr_state, turn_angle, trig_dict, line_scale)¶

Input: readsubstring takes in a string of the current lsystem, a starting point, the starting angle, the dictinary of angle trig values, current line scale, and what the line scale would change by

Output: returns angle and vertices

stack_loop 3D¶

This module makes the stack loop

lsystem.core.stack_loop3D.read_stack(stack, starting_pt, angle, obj)¶

Input list of strings (F, +, -) Output List of new vertices

lsystem.core.stack_loop3D.read_substring(lsys, curr_state, turn_angle, obj)¶

Input: readsubstring takes in a string of the current lsystem, a starting point, the starting angle, the dictinary of angle trig values, current line scale, and what the line scale would change by

Output: returns angle and vertices
